ygData.messageBody:
After some thought, something crossed my mind. I have multiple characters,
just like everyone else here I'm sure. But there's one thing I noticed
about my Wizard. She can got to ANY guild (except the DE one) to go and
train. Which is great.

With my DE SK, I can only train in my home town and with the Human guilds
(ie Freeport and Qeynos). The SK's in Grobb and Ogguk won't even talk to
me. That cuts down half my training options there almost (I never go out to
Qeynos with a DE SK). Some people might see where this is going. To
Balance things, why not make some of the SK spells race specific. IF hunans
and DE's share the same traits, give them a damage shield, and give the
ogres and trolls something else. I don't care what anyone else says, but
this game was not meant to be a soloing game. Go play bard's tale if you
want to solo.

Hence if there are going to be training restrictions, I think that variation
between the training houses would be a good thing. And make sure that mask
of the deceiver can't be used to get around this! (I hate that mask with a
passion). If anything it should turn people into little halfling druids.
Now there's the REAL evil class! <GRiN> just kidding.


From: "Brian Hook" <bhook@...>

Okie dokie, seems like getting a consensus is NOT going to happen.

So let's try another approach: what WOULD you like to see about the class to
make it more viable? The reason the high level shields and DoTs were pulled
is because (believe it or not) a lot of the players here are SKs and as such
know the class real well and giving them those capabilities made them into,
literally, tank mages. It's a scary sight seeing these guys at work.

As I've stated before, the thing that hurts the SK class are primarily race
issues -- a damage shield on a human or DE SK is not unbalancing, however it
IS unbalanced if you put it on a troll or ogre SK.

So what can be changed that makes the class more viable for non-big-races
but at the same time is not unbalancing for trolls/ogres?

I know HT comes up a lot, but there is a fear that HT could end up being
heavily abused (worst nightmare....party of 6 50th level SKs stand around
Mr. Named Mob that only pops once a day anyway, BAM 3000HP gone instantly
and you now have a mob that starts the fight at 1/2 HP).

If HT was upped slightly, had a slightly higher recharge rate, etc...what
are your suggestions?

Brian
